string-array.name: bda_questions
string-array.item: 1. As companies move past the experimental phase with Hadoop, many cite the need for additional capabilities, including _______________
3. According to analysts, for what can traditional IT systems provide a foundation when they’re integrated with big data technologies like Hadoop?
4. Hadoop is a framework that works with a variety of related tools. Common cohorts include ____________
7. All of the following accurately describe Hadoop, EXCEPT ____________
8. __________ can best be described as a programming model used to develop Hadoop-based applications that can process massive amounts of data.
9. __________ has the world’s largest Hadoop cluster.
10. Facebook Tackles Big Data With _______ based on Hadoop.

string-array.name: bda_option1
string-array.item: a) Improved data storage and information retrieval
a) Hadoop do need specialized hardware to process the data
a) Big data management and data mining
a) Hardtop processing capabilities are huge and its real advantage lies in the ability to process terabytes & petabytes of data
a) Creator Doug Cutting’s favorite circus act

string-array.name: bda_option2
string-array.item: b) Improved extract, transform and load features for data integration
b) Hadoop 2.0 allows live stream processing of real-time data
b) Data warehousing and business intelligence
b) MapReduce, MySQL and Google Apps
b) Hadoop uses a programming model called “MapReduce”, all the programs should confirm to this model in order to work on Hadoop platform
b) Cutting’s high school rock band

string-array.name: bda_option3
string-array.item: c) In Hadoop programming framework output files are divided into lines or records
c) The programming model, MapReduce, used by Hadoop is difficult to write and test
c) The toy elephant of Cutting’s son

string-array.name: bda_option4
string-array.item: d) Improved security, workload management, and SQL support
d) Collecting and storing unstructured data
d) A sound Cutting’s laptop made during Hadoop development

string-array.name: cloud_questions
string-array.item: 1. _________ computing refers to applications and services that run on a distributed network using virtualized resources.
3. ________ as a utility is a dream that dates from the beginning of the computing industry itself.
4. Which of the following is essential concept related to Cloud?
6. Which of the following cloud concept is related to pooling and sharing of resources?
7. ________ has many of the characteristics of what is now being called cloud computing.
8. Which of the following can be identified as cloud?
9. Cloud computing is an abstraction based on the notion of pooling physical resources and presenting them as a ________ resource.
10. Which of the following is Cloud Platform by Amazon?

string-array.name: cloud_option1
string-array.item: a) The massive scale of cloud computing systems was enabled by the popularization of the Internet
a) All applications benefit from deployment in the cloud

string-array.name: cloud_option2
string-array.item: b) Soft computing represents a real paradigm shift in the way in which systems are deployed
b) With cloud computing, you can start very small and become big very fast

string-array.name: cloud_option3
string-array.item: c) Cloud computing makes the long-held dream of utility computing possible with a pay-as-you-go, infinitely scalable, universally available system
c) Cloud computing is revolutionary, even if the technology it is built on is evolutionary

string-array.name: networking_questions
string-array.item: 1. When collection of various computers seems a single coherent system to its client, then it is called _________
2. Two devices are in network if __________
3. Which of the following computer networks is built on the top of another network?
5. Communication channel is shared by all the machines on the network in ________

string-array.name: networking_option1
string-array.item: a) a process in one device is able to exchange information with a process in another device
a) the computer that originates the data

string-array.name: networking_option2
string-array.item: b) a process is running on both devices
b) the computer that routes the data

string-array.name: networking_option3
string-array.item: c) PIDs of the processes running of different devices are same
c) the computer that terminates the data

string-array.name: networking_option4
string-array.item: d) a process is active and another is inactive
